text.title: Assessment 3
text.resume:
RESUME: You have {#ATTEMPTSREMAINING} attempt(s) remaining.

Introduction. You are resuming this exam. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit, sed diam nonummy nibh euismod tincidunt ut laoreet dolore magna aliquam erat volutpat.
text.pass:
Your Score: {score}%

You passed the exam. If you have paid for Continuing Education credit, once you have passed all four exams you will see a link available in the Parenting Counts Portal. Please click this link to print out your certificate.

Here are your results from the exam:

{$QPSUMMARY}
text.fail:
Your Score: {score}%

You did not pass the exam. If you would like to receive credit for Pillar 3, please review the material in Learning and Cognitive Development and then re-take the assessment.

Here are your results from the exam:

{$QPSUMMARY}
text.over_attempts: Sorry, you are over the attempt limit for this exam.
text.over_time: Sorry, you are past the alloted time period for this exam.

question.name: Question B
question.stem: By age 5, the brain has finished growing and changing.

feedback.final_incorrect: Sorry. That is not the correct answer.

question.name: Question C
question.stem: Match the following descriptions with the correct type of memory.
question.directions: Drag each description to the correct type of memory.

target_items.item: Consciously functions to remember things so a person is able to recall them later
Starts at birth and records impressions of vision, smell, hearing, and emotions, but does not recall specific events
A type of explicit memory that encodes and recalls events

feedback.final_incorrect: Sorry. That is not the correct answer.

question.name: Question C
question.stem: Match the following cognitive milestones in the correct order in which they occur.
question.directions: Drag each description to the correct order of occurance from earliest to latest.

target_items.item: Make connections between objects and their purpose
Show an increased understanding of the concept of time
Begin to use pretend play with symbolic use of objects

feedback.final_incorrect: Sorry. That is not the correct answer.

question.name: Question A
question.stem: In which of the following ways can parents facilitate cognitive growth?

foil.text: By helping their child feel safe and supported
By interacting with their child and being actively involved in the learning process
By pushing their child to learn more at an early age to speed up their cognitive development
By finding time to spend with their child and creating a safe area where their child can explore and play

feedback.final_incorrect: Sorry. That is not the correct answer.

question.name: Question A
question.stem: Imitation helps children learn which of the following?

feedback.final_incorrect: Sorry. That is not the correct answer.

question.name: Question C
question.stem: Imitation is one of the key ways that a child learns. For parents to successfully model behavior, four conditions are necessary.
question.directions: Drag each condition to their correct description.

target_items.item: Learning by watching an action or stimuli, or listening to sounds
Storing what has been seen or heard to bring it up later
Images or descriptions now become an action or behavior
Reinforcement that gives a reason to reproduce a behavior

feedback.final_incorrect: Sorry. That is not the correct answer.

question.name: Question A
question.stem: Some researchers believe mirror neurons help us in imitating other people's ________.

feedback.final_incorrect: Sorry. That is not the correct answer.

question.name: Question B
question.stem: Through his research, Albert Bandura found that children appeared to learn aggression through observing and imitating others.

feedback.final_incorrect: Sorry. That is not the correct answer.

question.name: Question A
question.stem: Which of the following statements are true about exploration?

foil.text: Exploration is mostly ineffective in helping children learn about their environment.
Children learn about their environment by testing and exploring the world around them.
Exploring the environment allows children to make predictions, experiment, look for explanations, and draw conclusions.

feedback.final_incorrect: Sorry. That is not the correct answer.

question.name: Question C
question.stem: In which order do the following developmental stages typically occur in regards to exploration.
question.directions: Drag each description to the order in which it occurs.

target_items.item: Understand basic safety issues, such as "hot" and "danger"
Repeat actions and behaviors to learn about cause and effect
Become more independent in exploration, and may intentionally disregard a parent's wishes

feedback.final_incorrect: Sorry. That is not the correct answer.

question.name: Question A
question.stem: A parent explains that her 11-month-old loves exploring as he crawls around the house. The parent is worried about safety issues. What advice could you offer her that allows the child to explore but educates her about the importance of child proofing her home?

foil.text: Explain to the parent that exploration is important for helping her child learn about his environment.
Suggest that the parent install latches for her cupboards, put in outlet covers, and put up safety gates to guard any stairs.
Suggest to the parent that she use discipline techniques with the child when he makes a mess.

feedback.final_incorrect: Sorry. That is not the correct answer.

question.name: Question A
question.stem: Which of the following are benefits of play?

foil.text: Play helps facilitate a child's development of communication and language skills.
Play strengthens cognitive development by allowing children to use trial and error.
Play impacts social and emotional development by encouraging children to regulate their emotions.
Play helps children develop physically by improving their fine and gross motor skills.

feedback.final_incorrect: Sorry. That is not the correct answer.

question.name: Question A
question.stem: Which of the following options complete the following sentence to be true. "As opposed to 15 years ago, today's generation of children ____________"

foil.text: Have more unstructured, free time to play.
Spend more time watching TV, playing video games, and using the computer.

feedback.final_incorrect: Sorry. That is not the correct answer.

question.name: Question B
question.stem: Play is unimportant until children are older.

feedback.final_incorrect: Sorry. That is not the correct answer.

question.name: Question A
question.stem: Mildred Parten discovered six types of play. Which of the following types are described in this program?

feedback.final_incorrect: Sorry. That is not the correct answer.
